com.soccerbuddy.annotation

Annotation Type ServiceMethod


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Documented
public @interface ServiceMethod
    A RESTful web service operation/method that usually accepts a CRUD resource and produces a result based on the HTTP method attempted.

    This annotation is intended to be used as a marker for AOP classes to intercept methods that contain them and deal with some of the common cross-cutting concerns like logging and profiling. However, too much of magic can lead to poor readability and maintainability, so the annotation only supports what's really necessary to be AOP'ed and the AOP code is required to adhere to this.

    Here's a definitive list of concerns the use of this annotation will help deal with:

    • logging (logging of the method execution event with the result of execution)
    • profiling (logging the start and end times of the methods to help measure the performance of the various method calls involved)
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    mystarrocks

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String action
      The action this web service operation performs.
      String customFailureMarker
      The custom log marker name to use in case of a failure.
      LogMarker failureMarker
      The log marker to use in case of a failure.

    • Element Detail

      • action

        public abstract String action
        The action this web service operation performs.

        Defaults to "".

        Returns:
        the action this web service operation performs
        Default:
        ""

      • failureMarker

        public abstract LogMarker failureMarker
        The log marker to use in case of a failure.

        Mutually exclusive with customFailureMarker(). If both are provided, #customFailureMarker() overrides this setting.

        Returns:
        the log marker to use in case of a failure
        Default:
        com.soccerbuddy.util.LogMarker.UNKNOWN_ERROR

      • customFailureMarker

        public abstract String customFailureMarker
        The custom log marker name to use in case of a failure.

        Mutually exclusive with failureMarker(). If both are provided, this overrides the marker provided by #failureMarker(). Defaults to "UNKNOWN_ERROR" if neither was provided.

        Returns:
        the log marker name to use in case of a failure
        Default:
        ""
